column4: is there a way to see progress when copying one dir to another with cli
is there a way to see progress when copying one dir to another with cli
I'm copying a huge directory to a backup drive... it's just been sitting there, i'm sure it's working but it'd be nice to see the progress, next time i do this
there's no extra option for the cp tool to show progress?
cp -v will show you the files as it's copying
With sudo, you only need to know your own password. With su, you need to password of the user you're trying to run commands as.
When you yank lines in vim, they are stored in vim, not any type of system-wide clipboard
no way to yank lines to system clipboard then?
There is, but the default yank doesn't. I believe it's +yy or *yy.

+p will paste from the clipboard
2010-11-13T00:57:00.000Z	ks3	goltoof	From within vim, do :help x11-selection for more information
2010-11-13T00:57:00.000Z	goltoof	ks3	 :S   not working for me..  when i his + it just jumps me somewhere, never says it yanked anything
2010-11-13T00:57:00.000Z	ks3	goltoof	No, preface with , so "+yy, the quote is needed
i want to yank 30 lines... so 30"+yy   ?
Probably? Don't use the command much myself, so try it out. If not, perhaps "30+yy or similar.
yea tried all different combos, still nada
